intro: Tovomita glazioviana, commonly known as the Glaziovian mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as those in the genus *Bumelia*. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Tovomita glazioviana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various bird species and contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat.
